Detailed Description

Declaration and Control of service.

Use:

  • Create a ControlServer, with the name for the service registration
  • add Variable, input, output ...
  • register the service (StartServer)
  • Process the control message by using ProcessMessages or in a new thread by calling one time StartThreadProcessMsg

Author:
Sebastien Pesnel

Definition at line 86 of file ControlServer.h.

00298                                         if ( TxtRecordIsFull )
00299                                         {
00300                                                 // undefine the last add
00301                                                 registerDnsSd->Properties.Undefine( listVariable.GetCurrent()->GetName() );
00302                                                 // Say the definition is partial
00303                                                 registerDnsSd->Properties["desc"] = "part";
00304                                         }
00305                                 }               
00306                         }
00307 
00308                         // Actually register
00309                         registerDnsSd->Register(false);
00310 
00311                         // Check if everything goes fine
00312                         if( registerDnsSd->IsRegistered() )
00313                         {
00314                                 OmiscidTrace( "registered '%s' as '%s' ok\n", serviceName.GetStr(), registerDnsSd->RegisteredName.GetStr() );
00315                                 // serviceName = registerDnsSd->RegisteredName;
00316                                 // NameVariable->SetValue( serviceName );
00317                                 StartThreadProcessMsg();
00318                                 return true;
00319                         }
00320 
00321                         // Ok, destroy the register Object
00322                         delete registerDnsSd;
00323                         registerDnsSd = NULL;
00324 
00325                         OmiscidError( "Changing PeerId from %8.8x ", serviceId );
00326 
00327                         // Generate a new PeerId and set it !
00328                         serviceId = ComTools::GeneratePeerId();
00329                         TcpServer::SetServiceId( serviceId );
00330 
00331                         OmiscidError( "to %8.8x because of name conflict.\n", serviceId );
00332                 }
00333 
00334                 // Something was wrong...
00335                 OmiscidError( "Registration of '%s' failed\n", serviceName.GetStr() );
00336         }
00337         catch(SocketException e)
00338         {
00339                 e.Display();
00340         }
00341 
00342         if ( registerDnsSd )
00343         {
00344                 // Delete DNS-SD object
00345                 delete registerDnsSd;
00346                 registerDnsSd = NULL;
00347         }
00348 
00349         // An error occurred, back to init mode
00350         SetStatus( STATUS_INIT );
00351         return false;
00352 }

void ControlServer::StartThreadProcessMsg (   ) 
 

Message processing in a thread.

run a thread where queries to the server are processed. In this case, the user don't need to use the methods ProcessMessages() and WaitForMessage(). call ProcessMessages when messages wait.

See also:
ProcessMessages, WaitForMessage

SimpleString  NewValue,
ControlServerStatus  status
)  [protected]
 

Called when a request of variable modification is done.

Must be be reimplemented by the user. The Input or Output is requested to connect to a port on a given host.

Parameters:
length [in] number of byte in the buffer
buffer [in] contain the new value on 'length' byte.
status [in] current status of the service. Useful for the variable that can be modified only during initialization.
va [in] contains the data about the variable.
